page.title: 18Energy
page.content: {Energy} There is Denby Grange Colliery in the block, the local name is the " wood pit " because of its location in a deep wooded valley. The shaft was sunk in 1854. The pit had a record coal production over a 5 day period ending 22nd June 1985, when 25,000 tons were produced. This was a U.K. record. The output of coal is 100% Power station fuel. From the pit it is transported underground (along with 9 other pits out of our block ) to Woolley West Side Washer, therafter by road to the power stations.
